title: New to Typophile
content:
I came across this site while looking for some obscure Latex reference for a term paper. The design of the site and the knowledgeable comments really piqued my curiosity.  
I do have a design background, but life took me away from pursing it as a career (I am currently a network engineer). So after a 5 year hiatus, I am trying to bring design and typography back into my everyday life. I will probably do a lot of lurking, but if anyone has a computer melt-down on them, I would be happy to lend a hand.

 [‹ '70s type roundup by Gene Gable at creativepro.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224051/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36185 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type modeled after Alphabet 26 / Bradbury Thompson ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224051/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18746 "Go to next forum topic")
